JobFullDesc: About Us: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, you have the opportunity to try new things and make a bigger difference across a broader end-to-end solution, a richer technology and product set, an expanded range of disciplines, a growing global footprint and a more diverse team of colleagues and customers.Job Summary: The SPY-6 Program Area is looking for a Finance Lead to support the SPY-6 Spares programs.  As the world's premier supplier of naval and maritime sensor solutions, Raytheon Technologies is providing innovative, affordable and breakthrough capabilities to the U.S. Navy’s Fleet with the Air & Missile Defense Radar (AMDR), Enterprise Air Surveillance Radar (EASR) making up the SPY-6 program portfolio.In this role, you will be the financial point of contact for the SPY6 Spares programs which will include cradle to grave financial support.  The Spares pipeline continues to grow as the SPY-6 Production Programs continue to deliver hardware to the fleet.  This is a great opportunity to support proposals and contract negotiations for new awards, including program start up and execution through to contract close out and final billings.  Responsibilities to Anticipate: In this role, you will execute a variety of program and financial control activities, including quarterly Estimates-at-Complete (EACs), Monthly Program Reviews (MPRs), Labor and Material Analysis and Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) responsibility. FP&A responsibility will include development of sales/cash/profit and booking forecasting.  You may also be required to support senior level projects and other ad hoc data reporting.This role does not include supervisory/management experience and will be a direct report to the SPY-6 Business Manager.If you are a currently a program control analyst looking for the next step or if you are looking to transition into a program control lead role this might be a perfect fit.Qualifications You Must Have:Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics or related 5+ Years finance related working experienceExperience with SAP  (BW, PRISM, APEX EV, PMX Tool or similar tools)Experience with Microsoft Office Suite of ProductsQualifications We Value:Experience in meeting critical deadlines and providing creative solutions to problemsProactive, creative and innovative in solving problems and issues Good written and verbal skills including demonstrated ability to succinctly present complex information to all levels of management and external parties such as audit agencies (DCAA/DCMA)Ability to interact with individuals at every level of the Financial and Program Office organizationsThe candidate must have strong analytical and problem solving skills.Demonstrated ability to prioritize concurrent requirements and accommodate numerous stakeholders.The candidate must have strong analytical and problem solving skills.Shows initiative by seeking ways to improve processes and data analysisStrong desire to learn and contribute in a team-based environmentCan work under general direction and participated in determining objectives of assignmentsUnderstanding of Raytheon financial and accounting policies and proceduresDoD ExperienceWhat We Offer:Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.Additional Details:This position requires either a U.S. Person or Non- U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.https://www.raytheonmissilesanddefense.com/capabilities/products/spy6-radars
